title: Soft Return in Photoshop CS3
content:
This is bugging the hell outta me.  
How do you do a soft return in Photoshop CS3? It used to be shift+enter, but now my “space after paragraph” setting is applied to every new line I create.

 [‹ Luxury Shoes and Handbag Company Logo Suggestion](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232638/http:/typophile.com/node/39517 "Go to previous forum topic") [the letter as a sign ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232638/http:/typophile.com/node/39437 "Go to next forum topic")
author: koleslaw

comments.content: I know you don’t want to hear this, but it’s always best to do as much typesetting as possible in InDesign or Illustrator.
Darn. But I’m designing websites where pixels matter.

“Illustrator’s “Save to Web” ain’t bad.”

A little of-topic, but has anybody tried Adobe Fireworks?
From what I understand all 3 apps use the same rendering engine as that in Fireworks to “save for web”. Or maybe I’m confusing something.

Koleslaw

Did you know you can use the text tool to draw a rectangle, and once you have done so the lines will automatically wrap?
